page.title: 03 Telecom ; Papa Westray
page.content: Normal counter services are available in the Sub-post office situated at Backaskaill. Mail arrives from Kirkwall by air on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday and by boat on Monday Wednesday and Friday and is dispatched every day except Wednesday. The mail is sorted and delivered by an auxillary postman who is employed for 20 hours per week. The telephone service has been modernised over the years and is included in the STD linkage for world wide communications via satellite. There are 35 telephones on the island and only 4 houses have no phone. Outgoing calls are relayed by a VHF repeater stationed on the island of Sanday to exchanges all over the world.
